result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry Allen Shephard

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Larry Allen Shephard in court.  Attorney Dennis P Coffey in court for Larry Allen Shephard.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing. Defense advises of possible resolution and requests a Plea and Sentencing hearing be set.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Larry Allen Shephard in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case scheduled for Oral Decision.  Defense advises that a motion was not filed as previously indicated; therefore the Court will not issue any oral decision. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests a Plea hearing be scheduled. Matter adjourned to Br. 9.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Larry Allen Shephard in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Court set new filing deadlines with parties. Defense has until June 10th, 2022, to file any motions. State has until July 11th, 2022, to file response to the motion. Defense has until July 29th, 2022, to submit any replies. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Decision scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Larry Allen Shephard in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties before the court for scheduling.  Court set a deadline for the State to provide discovery to defense (with exception of any crime lab reports) for 4/29; Deadline to file any motions is 5/20; if there would be a change of plea, all plea forms are due 5/27; and next court date is a continued pre trial conference in Br. 17.  mn  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Larry Allen Shephard in court with Attorney Dennis P Coffey; both appear by video. Samantha Raygo  appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 023798,
Payable Number: 991641,
Receipt Number: 22RP009933,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Larry Allen Shephard in court with attorney James F. Coffee.  Defendant Larry Allen Shephard in custody.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Larry Allen Shephard appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
